title: Rocket Lab launches Japanese SAR satellite
summary:
Rocket Lab launched a radar imaging satellite for a Japanese company March 14, the first of eight such missions under contract with that customer.

title: Crew-10 launches, finally clearing the way for Butch and Suni to fly home
summary: Crew 9 could return as early as next Wednesday.

title: Crew-10 launches to space station
summary:
Four people are on their way to the International Space Station on a typical crew rotation mission that has become enmeshed in political controversy.

title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 Launches to International Space Station
summary: Four crew members of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 mission launched at 7:03 p.m. EDT Friday from Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida for a science expedition aboard the International Space Station. title: Crew-10 On Its Way to ISS
summary: Space’s Crew Dragon Endurance lifted off from Kennedy Space Center this evening carrying Crew-10 to the International Space Station, two days later than planned. When they arrive at the ISS […]

title: Risk of Venous Thromboembolism During Spaceflight
summary: In October 2024, NASA’s Office of the Chief Health and Medical Officer (OCHMO) initiated a working group to review the status and progress of research and clinical activities intended to mitigate the risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) during spaceflight. The working group took place over two days at NASA’s Johnson Space Center; a second meeting […]

title: Sols 4479-4480: What IS That Lumpy, Bumpy Rock?
summary: Written by Ashley Stroupe, Mission Operations Engineer at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory Earth planning date: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 The days are getting shorter and colder for Curiosity as we head into winter. title: Investors bet on Europe’s space sector as geopolitical winds shift
summary:
Rising defense budgets and geopolitical shifts are creating new investment opportunities for Europe’s space industry, early-stage investors said at the Satellite Conference.

title: SpaceX readies to rescue astronauts from International Space Station
summary:
SpaceX is readying to launch the Crew-10 mission this evening, which will bring home U.S. astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who have been stuck on the International Space Station for nine months. SpaceX is working alongside NASA to bring the two astronauts home, and all systems and weather conditions are looking ideal to launch […]
